explanation:
code_hardening: Validated the instance field usage by defensively handling negative or very small durations; durations less than or equal to one second immediately return a safe default. Early returns avoid unnecessary object creation.
resolve_compilation_errors: Removed static context and parameters, computed duration from the instance field time, and relied on existing in-scope constants (ONE_SECOND, ONE_MINUTE, ONE_HOUR, ONE_DAY). No imports were required.
exception_handling: none.
logic_customization: Computed duration as System.currentTimeMillis() minus the instance field time, returned only the largest non-zero unit using early returns, enforced the <= ONE_SECOND → "0 second" rule, and applied singular/plural semantics where singular returns only the unit name.
refactoring: Introduced a new instance method named getTimes, simplified the logic to a linear days→hours→minutes→seconds check, and removed concatenation, commas, and additional wording.
misc: Updated the method comment to reflect the new behavior and semantics. No new custom API calls were introduced.
